snippet: The House of Commons voted to allow the in vitro creation of embryos using the DNA of three people, a procedure that could prevent the inheritance of genetic diseases.
abstract: Britain's House of Commons votes to permit in vitro creation of babies utilizing DNA of three people, procedure designed especially for women who have mitochondrial defects; if law passes in House of Lords, Britain will be first country to allow technique involving changing human egg or embryo before transferring it to womb.
lead_paragraph: The House of Commons voted to allow the in vitro creation of embryos using the DNA of three people, a procedure that could prevent the inheritance of genetic diseases.

headline.main: Britain Set to Approve Technique to Create Babies From 3 People
headline.print_headline: Britain Set to Approve Technique to Create Babies From 3 People
